intro: Froesiodendron longicuspe, commonly known as the long-leaf froesiodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its elongated leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
